page.title: 10A WALK TO THE DOWNS
page.content: Turn into the small lane going W.S.W. from the Pound at map ref.30573282; follow the lane (Buckholt Road) until it forks into three unmade tracks. Take the middle track, which climbs steeply between high hedges and old yews. When the track turns left follow the path to the right by the{Hampshire and{Isle of Wight Naturalists' Trust notice board. Follow the path to an open space among the beeches with a steep-sided coombe to the right. From this point either carry on to the path along the top of the scarp with glimpses of the wide view to the N.E. or proceed with care across the steep chalk sward and scrub on the scarp itself. According to the season you will see many interesting wild plants and animals (particularly butterflies) for which the area is famous. (See page 3 for further information.)
